ygData.subject: OCR Update
ygData.msgSnippet: I thought I d give a brief update of the stuff Philip and I are working on these days, in case anyone s interested.  I ve alluded to it in a couple of messages

X-Yahoo-Profile: blue5432

I thought I'd give a brief update of the stuff Philip and I are
working on these days, in case anyone's interested.  I've alluded to
it in a couple of messages already.

Basically, we're applying the active vision approach similiar to
Darren Izzard's OCR experiments and Ken's roving eye approach to Go.

Our active vision system includes movement along the x and y axes,
zoom, rotation, and mirror flip capabilities.  The resolution of the
eye is parameterized.

We started by simply testing whether or not our networks could
discriminate between all-black canvasses and all-white ones.  That
done, we moved on to basic shapes, solid black circles and solid black
squares on white backgrounds.  All images are 50x50 pixel tifs. 
Between each generation we add both positional and rotational variance
to the images, so that they are repositioned +/- 10 pixels along the
x/y axes based on randomly generated values, and are rotated about +/-
20 degrees.  With 10 circle images and 10 squares, we were able to
evolve networks that could discriminate between the two sets with 100%
accuracy.

Now we're working with character recognition, specifically capital
letters in san-serif font, again on a 50x50 canvas.  I've uploaded our
base images as .jpgs in the Photos section:

http://photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/lst?.dir=/Derek+and+Philip%27s+OCR+Test+Cases&.src=gr&.order=&.view=t&.done=http%3a//briefcase.yahoo.com/

So far we've just worked with discriminating sets of two letters: A
and B.  And we've also done some experiments trying to discriminate A
from all other letters.  So far, we've acheived about 95% accuracy
rates in these types of tasks.

Derek
